resources.string:
Hi my name is Neal Doherty. Having spent many years in the food industry I have just commenced my second career.as a tour guide. I completed the Failte Ireland (Irish Tourist Board) guide course three years ago with a merit and have been guiding ever since. As a member of Toastmasters International I have also learned the public speaking skills that ensure an excellent delivery for my guests.
In order to keep the presentations fresh I am constantly changing them to get the best mix of humour and fact. This helps to keep the presentations interesting for me and fascinating for my guests.
Confusious said: If you can make your hobby your job then you will never have to work a day in your life. While I have been very busy guiding for the last three years I have not considered one day of it as work. I have really enjoyed looking after and entertaining my guests during that period
If you decide to let me guide for you here in Ireland, I look forward to meeing you our your clients If you decide to make alternative arrangements I really hope you enjoy your visit. Thanks for taking the time to read this anyway.
Hear about the fictitious fish vendor of Dublin and the ‘interesting’ nicknames that we Dubliners have for her statue. Join with me as I sing a verse of the song!

So much a part for your visit to Dublin. You will hear lots of references to the famous ‘Black Stuff’. Yes it’s an acquired taste, but it’s a taste that is acquired easily! I tell you the story of Guinness that will whet your thirst.
